result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonardo De La Cruz
Current: 119 Charles St., Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 06-07-2022)
Prior: 802 Humboldt Ave, Wausau, WI 54403

No contact with victim(s): K.R.D.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Absolute sobriety from alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents (except for Great Dane for work purposes only).    Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within one week.
